area_name: Harmony Wall Top Rope/ Trad Area

content.description: Nice hand crack. There is a chalkstone about the size of a bread box about 8' up in the crack. Small hands to the bread box then opens up and closes again to a hand and fist crack.
content.location: About 150' down the cliff from Mickey Mantle (approx. 110 steps from garbage can)

content.description: Good start with obvious hold as you work your way up. Crux is working through the flake on the left side and you should be able to reach anchors from there

Climb up the face a couple feet right of the Ban The Bomb crack to reach shallow, left-facing seam. Where the seam ends use small pockets, underclings, side pulls, and a thin crimp to work your way up through the small roof.
Climb the face to a large gully then right of the gully up a small crack good top out
content.location: This rout is twenty feet left of Harmony Crack

content.description: Ascend thin, blocky holds up the arête located to the left of Mail Slot
Start up a few face moves to gain a crack in a shallow, left-facing, corner that arches over slightly to the right and then goes straight up.
content.location: To the left and around the corner from Ban The Bomb and Shruti.

content.description: Surmount the bulge and mantle up into the dihedral to gain a finger crack. Continue up the dihedral using the crack and stemming to reach the top.
content.location: Harmony Wall at Paint Creek State Park OH.  Left of the Buckeye Buttress arête is a dihedral.

content.description: Follow the seam in the middle of the face located between Red hawk Arête and Bearcat Chimney. Variations exist on either side of the seam.

Start about 10 feet right of the slot under a left-facing, arching bulge. Climb the face to reach a crack just left of the bulge and continue up the crack to where it ends in a roof. Traverse left under the roof until you can surmount the roof up through the slot.
content.location: Harmony Wall Paint Creek State Park OH.  Look for a prominent slot above a small overhang about 50 feet left of the Mickey Mantle dihedral.

content.description: Start directly underneath the slot and climb up the light colored streak on the face through the overhang at the slot
content.location: Look for a prominent slot above a small overhang about 50 feet left of the Mickey Mantle dihedral.

content.description: The route climbs the nose of the arête. Start directly in front of the arête which is under cut and there is a small rock on the ground directly below. Boulder your way up using the cracks and face holds to gain the arête. Follow the arête to the top exit right or lower. The route has lots of lichen but all the holds needed have been cleaned and the climb is well worth doing. The start can be a bit challenging.
content.location: This is a large arête about 10' left of "Who Forgot the Jam?

content.description: Stem up the shallow, left-facing, dihedral and then use the hand crack and/or face holds to climb up into the gully above. Continue up the crack, left of the gully.
content.location: This route ascends the obvious dihedral and crack left and around a corner from Gumby's Gully.

content.description: Scramble up this easy short crack
content.location: Located half way between Peacenik and Harmony Crack.

content.description: Climb up through a large roof then pull your way through the green moss
content.location: Located ten feet left of Gumby's Gully

content.description: The crux is at the beginning of this climb. Once past this it’s fairly easy climbing to the top.
content.location: In between “Who Forgot the Jam” and “Route Beer”. Follow the narrow trail until you notice a few larger cavelike features in the upper portion of the wall. The route follows the right side of them.

content.description: Straight forward, follows the arete up pockets and crimps.
content.protection: TR, very hard to protect with gear.  Could go on small pro maybe up to finger sized stuff in a few pods.
content.location: Ascends the first arête beyond where the trail to the base of the cliff splits off of the Harmony Trail.

content.description: Work your way up the obvious chimney to offwidth and climb through the overhang using the hand crack in the dihedral above.  (Best if climbed in the fall or winter to avoid the spiders.)
content.location: Harmony Wall, located in the dihedral left of the Miami Wall face

content.description: Jam and crank up the obvious crack in the overhanging face left of Bearcat Chimney and Shruti.
content.location: On the face to the left of Bearcat Chimney

pathTokens: Harmony Wall Top Rope/ Trad Area

content.description: This area includes top rope and traditional climbing using trees for anchors. Climbs range in height between 20 and 30 feet, and some cracks can be safely lead on trad gear. Climbing has been allowed here since the 90s, but route information has not been kept up-to-date on MP. If you climb a line that is not listed here, please share information and photos to help expand the route resources for the area.
